P009784.project_name: Agricultural Refinance and Development Corporation Credit Project (04)

keywords.cdata: accounting,administrative costs,Agricultural Credit,agricultural development,agricultural production,agricultural research,Agricultural Societies,Agriculture,animal health,animal husbandry,aquifers,arable land,bad debts,Balance Sheets,bank structure,banking system,banking systems,boards of directors,borrowing,capital formation,Commercial Banks,consumers,Cooperative banking,Cooperative Banks,crops,debt,Development Banks,Economic Analysis,Economic Situation,employment,equipment,equity capital,exchange rate,expenditures,exports,extension,extension services,Farmers,fertilizers,FISCAL YEAR,fish,Fisheries,fishing,forestry,GDP,health services,imports,incomes,Land Development,Land Reclamation,liquidity,livestock,living standards,loan supervision,MARKETING,mergers,new entrants,per capita income,private sector,productivity,Regional Rural Banks,Reserve Bank of India,Rural Development,savings,Soil Conservation,State Intervention,timber,time deposits,transport,Water Resources

project_abstract.cdata: The purpose of the project is to help India increase agricultural production and to strengthen agricultural credit institutions by supporting a two-year ARDC program of refinancing loans for investments in agriculture and an intensive training program for the staff of participating banks. Lending under the project would be for minor irrigation (including land development), plantation and horticulture, livestock and fisheries, market yards and storage. The only serious project risk would be the continuation of high loan overdues of the participating banks. Special measures are included in the project to deal with this situation.
